item.title: Gulf Air expands its direct presence to four cities in Northern Pakistan
item.description:
Source: Gulf Air. Bahrain’s national airline, Gulf Air, has established four new sales offices in the northern Pakistani cities of Islamabad, Lahore, Peshawar, and Sialkot.Â Gulf Air currently operates 23 weekly flights between Bahrain and several cities in Pakistan, including Islamabad, Karachi, Lahore, Peshawar, and Sialkot. Travelers can book flights to and from Pakistan through various channels, including the airline’s website (gulfair.com), their 24/7 Worldwide Contact Centre (+973 1737 3737), any Gulf Air sales office, or authorized travel agents...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/gulf-air-expands-its-direct-presence-to-four-cities-in-northern-pakistan/

item.title: Expatstoday provides important advice for expatriates living in the Gulf region
item.description:
Source: Expatstoday A new online platform, Expatstoday, aims to attract individuals considering a move to Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, or the UAE. The website provides insights into living conditions in these Gulf countries. The company behind the platform emphasizes its commitment to providing accurate, current, and trustworthy information. While the sections dedicated to Gulf countries appear well-established, suggesting an active user base, pages for other countries seem relatively new, often lacking listings in various categories...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/expatstoday-provides-important-advice-for-expatriates-living-in-the-gulf-region/
